intro: Palicourea lobbii, commonly known as the yellow palicourea, is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical shrubs and trees. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America, particularly in humid lowland areas. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often glossy and dark green in color. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically white or pale yellow, with five petals. Palicourea lobbii is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
